p: The plasticity of the biological characteristics of A. butcheri is reflected in marked differences between its growth and maturity schedules among south‐western Australian estuaries in which the physico‐chemical, hydrological and morphological characteristics and composition of potential food sources differ markedly (Brearley, 2005; Chuwen, Platell, & Potter, 2007; Gardner et al., 2013; Sarre, Platell, & Potter, 2000; Sarre & Potter, 2000). Variations in the growth of A. butcheri have sometimes been positively related to temperature and sometimes inversely (Cottingham et al., 2018; Doubleday et al., 2015) and the particularly slow growth rate in the Moore River Estuary in south‐western Australia was considered to be related inter alia to the very low salinities that characterize this system (Sarre & Potter, 2000).
